title: Thanos Creator Jim Starlin Wants In On Avengers: Infinity War
text:
Thanos Creator Jim Starlin Wants In On Avengers: Infinity War Joseph Schmidt Back to Article Image of 
Stan Lee seems to have all the fun when it comes to movie cameos, but it doesn’t have to be a monopoly. 
Writer of the Infinity Gauntlet and Thanos creator Jim Starlin recently expressed frustration that he’d received more money from the KGBeast’s appearance in Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice than he had from all of his Marvel characters’ cinematic appearances combined, but that doesn’t mean he’s opposed to the pitching in for the House of Ideas. 
While highlighting the new Avengers: Infinity War production video that features his gigantic Infinity Gauntlet Omnibus, the writer and artist expressed a willingness to make his on screen debut in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. 
Starlin has created many Marvel characters that have become beloved additions to the MCU, including Gamora and Drax of the Guardians of the Galaxy . 
While he hasn’t had quite the impact that Marvel godfather Stan Lee has, his footprint on the current state of the film universe is undeniable. 
If Anthony and Joe Russo are listening, maybe they should consider a cameo appearance from the author of story of which their foundation is based on. Starlin is certainly up for it.
